intro: Hieracium ferroviae, commonly known as the railway hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, often reddish stems. Native to central and eastern Europe, it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It is often found along railway tracks and roadsides, where its adaptability to human-altered environments is evident.
